intro: Jonesiella mearnsii, commonly known as the Mearns' jonesiella, is a species of flowering plant in the family Fabaceae. It is native to South Africa and is characterized by its small, delicate leaves and pea-like flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and thrives in full sun. It is often found in coastal areas and is adapted to withstand salt spray and strong winds. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens, though it is not widely distributed outside its native range.
